item.title: Comment on USA religion fact of the day by Steven
item.description:
Reply to EdR:

This is not surprising as women now rule Anglosphere. Young men seem to be particularly troubled and are looking for meaning in their lives. I have sons in their very early twenties and I make sure I'm available to them when they need me. They are doing well.

Despite the fact that women are doing very well and men are not, women seem to get all the attention. I could be wrong because, you know, the bias thingy.

There are some very bad "role models" out there.

I do not want to downplay the troubles of men, which I think are important and growing. But I'm not sure women are doing that great.
They seem increasingly neurotic, anxious, and insecure - more so than ever. Moreover, they are using their dominant political position to attempt to address their perceived problems. However, for the most part they are wielding their political power on ineffective policies that mainly reinforce their misguided perception that they lack power. This is turning the political cycle into a kind of positive feedback loop of feminine grievances.
